column3: I had past this spot many times but once I went in I was pleasantly surprised with the coffee quality. To my understanding they use intelligentsia coffee beans which the espresso shots are packed with flavor. They have a tart note that I really love.  I’ve only tried the coffee so this rating is for that, not the food. But I can say that the espresso over ice here is spectacular.  The staff have always been welcoming and the lively music is a great touch. I’d strongly suggest getting a coffee here, sitting either inside or outside and vibe out.

Lots of glass windows, so this is a bright little coffee place.  The hot chocolate was really good. The sausage breakfast sandwich was good, but for me, it was missing something… maybe more seasoning in the sausage patty.  But I wouldn’t mind visiting again to try something else off their breakfast menu.
Adorable and cute coffee shop. Really loved the vibe in here. The coffee was very delicious. Haven't tried the food yet. Good place for work or just hang out

I had a caramel Americano with cream the first day we were in San Francisco. It was delicious. We tried several other coffee shops around the area, but in the last day, decided to to back because it was the best. The croissant breakfast sandwich was good also.

I loved the vibe of this place, there was a very chill dog hanging out inside. Not sure if the dog is a regular in the shop but he really made it special. Some of the best coffee we had in town while visiting. The foam on my latte and my husbands cappuccino was impressive.

Breakfast bagel-sandwhich was very good and filling. I got an iced white mocha and it was good but a bit milky— so get an extra shot if you want stronger coffee drinks. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating, and it’s dog friendly with a water bowl for your furry friend as well!

This place has a very nice, open interior. It’s a great place to study or get work done. It has high wood tables and there’s plenty of light from the glass walls. They also have outdoor seating which is made more enjoyable by the hilly environment. You can get some morning sun too.  Coffee good. I get cappuccinos here regularly and am never disappointed. They have pastries and sandwiches. Their breakfast sandwiches are good, and they have options for <$10.  They see dog friendly, staff are welcoming, and their restroom is wheelchair (ADA) accessible, singly occupancy, and all gender/gender-neutral.

I like the vibe of this cafe. I love their playlist, the casual atmosphere of the shop, and their coffee is quite decent. A good spot to relax and immerse yourself in conversation or a good book in the afternoon.

love this open concept little café. pretty basic, no-frills menu. no vegan options that i saw, but a couple vegetarian. there was only one employee running the show, but they were absolutely killing it!
Really cool place with relaxed friendly atmosphere, wifi and great coffee!
Good breakfast, been here twice and both times I got a Bear Claw / Bagel & Cream cheese / and Orange Juice. It was good as hell...  What you guys from up North here would call "Hella delightful"...

Lovely spot to hang on a sunny Saturday afternoon. I got tea and relaxed at the large shared tables. A little bit expensive for tea, mind you.  But so it goes. I liked the vibe, people, and big windows opening to the street. A little Pixies on the speakers helped to. ❤️

Good place to relax in the morning, they make so good drinks and coffee (not a fan of coffee btw) tho it's really expensive it your going to eat here. I spent 40 dollars on 3 sandwiches, not including drinks. Would come here again just to grab a morning matcha drink ;]
Good breakfast sandwich! Scone was okay. Great service!

This place let me do my work for a number of days before I got to move in to my new place. The coffee was good and cheap, the wifi was spotty, but no one heckled me and I didn’t feel like I was ever gonna be asked to buy another thing.  Lots and lots of locals here and their dogs.
One of our favorite SFO cafes! The Sausage Breakfast Sandwich is almost better than sex (almost). The coffee is always delicious.
Lovely little shop. I can’t remember the guy’s name, but he made the best Americano I’ve ever had in my life! Amazing!
Out of this world breakfast sandwich and delicious coffee! Such a great spot!
They have really friendly personale, good breakfast & professional Service ❤️🇲🇦👉SF …

A down to earth, neighbourhood coffee shop! Good selection of coffee, teas and snack food! Nice, polite & friendly staff. Its been our breakfast cafe, during our few days away, here in San Francisco! ☕👍 …

Maybe I was there on a bad day, because the  barista was really put out, when I asked for a spoon, there won’t be any. Millennial eye-roll when I asked her for a glass of tapwater to go with my meal. Coffee is good. You have to beg for Wi-Fi password. The food is a little pricey. Not bad, but not great either.
A bit pricey for the quality and ambiance. Very average breakfast and coffee.  However, I love it for a low-key happy hour and (limited) outdoor seating

It's close to st. Francis Hospital The coffee is Intelligentsia coffee it's from Seattle I believe .it's good ,very good It has  big house Cabernet and Zinfandel  Friendly staff and good breakfast sandwiches
Paid $5 something for an ice chai that has zero chai in there. Just a plain milk. Absolutely ridiculous and the barista is not friendly even tipping $1. Won’t be coming back
Great breakfast sandwiches and their latte coffee's are awesome as well!
Visiting from Utah and found this coffee house here! Guys! Come check it out! Great service, great morning food, and overall GREAT COFFEE! 5 outta 5

I hate iced matcha lattes. I just dislike the taste of matcha. but I’m also stubborn and refuse to dislike a food/ drink so I will repeatedly order them to become accustomed to the flavor. my God. this place made the best iced matcha lattes I’ve ever had. they made me a believer. I’m not from San Fran but when I come here for work I will always stop by in the mornings for one. thank you cup of joe.
There is an amazing Caffeehouse and nice people
Friendly and compassionate staff, power for my laptop, great coffee and food, and comfortable indoor and outdoor seating make this place my #1 go-to.  I love it!

Wonderful staff and great owner!  I wish they had more vegan food options but have recently started doing pop ups with local baker L.H.Bakeshop!  The espresso drinks are great with all the good plant milk options.  I get my lattes from here everyday.  2nd shoutout to the wonderful amazing and kind staff.  They have a great team and the owner is so cool with encouraging local artists to put up art there.

I'm moving out of my apartment down the street next week, and this is the business I am most sad to leave behind.  It's pleasant, quick, and has good pastries and espresso. I especially like sitting outside in the morning.

Pros: Great playlist, large open windows for people watching, and good beers on tap.  Cons: The coffee is just.. not very good. Tried to give them the benefit of the doubt at first, but it's pretty consistently flavorless. Just come here for beers and the environment instead.
I ask the cashier twice if it was fresh squeeze OJ and he said yes with a bad attitude. I just got home and start drinking this completely artificial juice! Totally scam !
Food is delicious and service was great! I suggest the Croque-Madame!
The employees & owner are great. Lively atmosphere of regulars & locals. I've been in town for 4 days & drank coffee here every morning. *Breakfast sandwich with sourdough is tasty.
They have a great coffee and great people...

Cup A Joe is my go to neighborhood cafe. Coffee on the way to work? Beer and a book on the way home? Large, unhealthy breakfast sandwiches when I wake up hungover on the weekend? Check, check, check!  Want to pay $6 for a latte with a heart drawn in the foam? Looking for a biography of the Central American farmers who produced your cup of single-origin, small-batch, lovingly-handcrafted, pour-over coffee? This is not your place!  But if you want a relaxed, comfortable hangout to meet up with friends, read a book, or watch people go by, Cup A Joe is a great spot. Chill atmosphere, nice staff, good music, decent if unexceptional drinks, and not packed to the gills with laptop zombies all day - this place nails the "urban neighborhood cafe" atmosphere.

As a new local and neighbor at the time, my roommate introduced me to Cup A Joe literally across the street. And, what could be more fun and convenient is this local coffee cafe/hangout, my new place to call home away from home. Of course being popular to locals like myself, and amongst the energy of city life, you can still find refuge wether you prefer sitting inside or outside, or take your tasty aromatic joe with you. Do your thing here, and enjoy the convenient comforts of soothing and tasty delights. I am lucky to have (what I call now a souvenir) a genuine cup from Cup A Joe that I purchased years ago.
Great coffee. The espresso is delicious. Good food options.  Chill vibe.
Latte was smooth and very drinkable! Pastries a bit on the chewy side and not flaky enough but they're not terrible. Okay option but there are better places a few blocks away.

I really want to give this place 5 stars, just like I want to love it more than I do. The atmosphere is great, the employees are cool, there’s WiFi, beer, food, and outdoor seating. What else can you ask for? The only drawback is, I go here literally every day, and never get hooked up w an occasional free drink. I’m just of the thought that regulars should occasionally get a thank you w a free coffee. It’s also a little on the pricy side. So even though I go here every day, my first thought is, “ugh $5 ice coffee.”

Stopped here for a quick bite one morning and it was pleasant. The breakfast sandwiches are pre-made and they toast them when you order. Turned out pretty good actually. Beats fast food and the airport food I've been eating while here in SF. Coffee was solid as well.

This coffee shop has great coffee, a good selection of plant-based milk, delicious bagels, and excellent music.  They need to work on single-use plastics though. A lot of customers drink in the cafe from disposable cups even though they have ceramic mugs available. And some dishes are served with plastic cutlery - time to get metal cutlery for dine-in customers!

I Have been here only twice but already can feel the vitality vibe of this cafe and the neigborhood around it. As a writer, a vital space is very important for me be creative and this place give me that energy. Drinks and foods here are expensive and not that impressive. A good thing is that staff really listen to your order. Vegan/veggie friendly. Excuse me for my bad drawing, I did borther to take a photo because the place was so enjoyable. The drawing is just the projection of me and how I feel about it lol.
The espresso was weak the food was ok. Lots of outside seating.. had high hopes for this spot but really pretty average.

I enjoyed the coffee and bagel but was off put by the rude barista who used no social skills in asking the person ahead of me to step out of the way. Asking "can you move" in a condescending, whiney manner just set a negative tone and not only made that customer feel uncomfortable,  but made me feel that way too.
Terruble 'service' - rude staff, lost at least 3 orders including my coffee while i was there, and then blaming customers and staff argueing amongst each other.

A respectful, relaxed mixed croud. Fun or work.  I go there dressed up or down and am treated very nice. The staff is friendly and happy. They have delish coffee, as good as starbucks, wifi and in a pinch I work on my computer from there. Students do too. Medium to low noise. Enjoy..

Great little spot to work from or sit outside in the sun and have a beer. They only have one size coffee mug, regardless of ordering a small medium or large. So just order a small if you want room for cream.
Coffee was great. Scone was fresh. Also loved the seating outside . It was morning time and sunny so perfect place to sip coffee along the side walk.

Yes.  This is the kind of corner coffee shop where you want to hang out.  You can sit there all day on your laptop nursing that $2 coffee.  Good looking people will walk by; folks with piercings and tatoos will sit next to you and scribble in notebooks; you can take an indoors or outdoor table; there’s art.  What else do you slackers want??

Nice place for a beer or a quick snack. Good atmosphere, with students hanging out, studying or doing their stuff on their pcs. They have good beers, with a very low price during happy hour. Some good panini.
Overall good clean spot with great breakfast sandwiches.. just pricey.
Cutesy little coffeehouse / happy hour place to have some affordable beer in the evening. The breakfast sandwiches are just OK, though, nothing fancy along the lines of Jane or farm:table.
perfect spot, always great quality drinks & service! welcoming vibe
Saturday's late afternoon cashier was outstanding! Great Cappuccino💖😉 …
A quality shop with nice staff and outdoor seating. Decent selection of food to go with the drinks. Prices are a little more than expected but not terrible.
Really tasty sandwiches and stronger coffee than the average American cup, which is nice. Fantastic decor and just a nice place to sit and enjoy a breakfast.
Cozy,  spacious but could be little crowded when there are tourists.  Overall,  it is a good place to hang out. Internet connection is solid too!
Nice neighborhood cafe, great coffee, good music. Loved their dog. They have plenty of outdoor tables, I liked that.
Great local spot to get espresso and your regular craft beers. Nice view of nob hill neighborhood. Outside seating.
Quaint mixed menu for all day. Good sized breakfast sandwich portions and coffee in ceramics. Beer on tap. Good seating and restroom. Open late.
Good neighborhood coffee house for above average coffee and pastry and snacks.
Great coffee and good breakfast sandwhiches. The staff are not Starbucks friendly but who cares at 6 or 7 in the morning when all you need is good coffee and maybe a good breakfast sandwhich.

Staff was extremely rude, got upset with me for asking for WiFi and when I didn’t see my coffee on the counter practically yelled at me. WiFi was also very weak. A good coffee shop otherwise with good seating and good coffee.
Great place, ok service but coffee is missing one of the most important ingredients..... flavour. Maybe I was just unlucky?

My morning wouldn't be the same without Cup-A-Joe - Intelligencia coffee with a breakfast burrito is just the ticket to get things rolling on the way to work. And after a long day, the 9 taps of cold beer know just how to get the evening on track.
I last was in that Cup of Jo Mother's day of 2017, the female cashier was ignoring me. DgS snatched my card out my hand, I did tip. Prior times never had bold rude experience. They deleted my review
Open until 10pm, this cafe is a great casual spot for everything. Whether it be food, a snack, coffee or drink. Lots of indoor and road side seating. Free wifi too!
Great coffee and good customer service. Only one person was working but they were quick and efficient.
Great for breakfast, wide variety, great coffee, wine and food in the evening, free wi-fi, sit outside and watch the world go by, near the art college so Bohemian feel. Highly recommended.
Good coffee! Smart, friendly gal serving it. The food looks fresh and tasty. I'll be back regularly!
Delicious coffee and incredibly chill atmosphere. Was very productive in this space. Free Wi-Fi and power sockets are a big plus.
Friendly neighborhood coffee shop with great food and coffee, as well as beer on tap. What more could a person ask for?
No discounts on coffee refills? Damn it.  Sandwitches are good and heated up properly in an oven not just microwaved.
Delicious white mocha which wasn't too sweet and really quench my coffee craving for the day. I would highly recommend Cup-A-Joe Coffee
The owner, Joe, makes an awesome latte. Most of the rest of the staff does too but sometimes when they're busy, the quality slips. very slightly.
The real secret: you can get awesome beers on tap through the afternoon for $4.95. Post up outside and have a grand old time.
Because of a coner shop it's surrounded by windows which always open and smoke coming from the streets. Pastries are dry and the WiFi is very slow.
Fair prices, lots of options and great staff. Came here almost every morning of my stay in SF. Loved how I was treated and the food.
Wonderful place, a favorite of the Art students and lower Nobhill regulars. My Cafe Americana was just right.
Friendly neighborhood coffee shop. Great grab-n-go coffee or sit and enjoy. Good eats too.
Great coffee and great service. A must for folks nearby or walking in the hood
Good coffee place situated on a corner block great for people watching and good looking interiors. The ice coffee was heaven
Friendly staff and a good place to sit and relax. However, the espresso-based drinks are somewhat diluted.
A very San Francisco coffee shop.  The coffee was good and there are places to sit and work.  Wifi available.
I wanted to like this place but it’s not good!! Overpriced food uncomfortable seats and the music is really loud rave style very distracting!!
It was good coffee not so hot bagel took a few minutes but the big croissant was delicious
Great place for coffee and a breakfast sandwich. I enjoyed my coffee and watched the city go by. Great place!
Friendly staff, good beer selection. Just wish they have more veggie sandwiches.....to cater to the vegetarians ☺️
Pretty good coffee and food. Also very dog friendly. But the wifi is   s  l  o  w
Amazing breakfast sandwiches. Probably my favorite in the whole city. The buns they use are just delicious.
Small place. Coffee tastes like garbage. Cappuccino is served in small espresso cups.
Decent cup of Joe.

Well I had a cup of coffee  here the other day and it was pretty  bad ....Well really  really  bad I thought maybe it was just because I came in mid day so this morning I tried a mocha it was way worse then I thought It even could be the worst I've ever  had it tasted like a re-heated latte with sugar added it had the same after taste coffee has with sugar....maybe just coffee with extra sugar the young girl at the register was nice but it was keeping me out a little to see an older guy behind the counter staring at a young girl  (probably legal but did not appear so) the worst coffee in sf creepy  owner domestic beer what else could one ask for
Don't let their awesome drinks distract you from the fact that this is also one of the best breakfast/lunch spots in the neighborhood.
It's an OK place for coffee, with indoors and outdoors seating.  It has a large table where people play chess and other games.
Great place to people watch and get some with done. Great coffee and hot breakfast selection.
I love Cup a Joe’s... Best coffee on Nob Hill! And the staff is super friendly, too! ✌️❤️😎 …
Loved the service here. Early morning late made extra hot. Good selection of food
What a great place to get some afterwork work done. Or grab a coffee on a weekend morning and people watch. Big fan. Free wifi.
Fantastic happy hour prices, nice crowd and friendly staff. All in all a great place for a beer.
This place is great! Been here several times and always a cool atmosphere, good food and drinks.
Coffee shop was very dirty, bathroom even more so. The service was very standoffish... my orders were met with blank faces.
Great coffee.. Food needed some spice but that's not bad
Perfect people watching location, amazing breakfast sandwiches, kind staff.
Great Coffee! A fun sidewalk cafe.
Great hangout spot, good coffee, very polite staff, excellent social environment.
A great place to sit down with your laptop or a good book and enjoy excellent coffee in a wonderful atmosphere
Nice place to get a regular coffee and sip while you are doing your main job: answering emails...
Many students here. Great place for meetings or studying. Good coffee.
So so lovely!! (Also some dude who worked there gave me free stickers he designed himself)
Called to make a special request to have someone sing happy Birthday to my Daughter and the person who answered the phone, said he didn't have time, Hmmpf     I was very disappointed..
Great coffee and very tasty chocolate banana bread, nice atmosphere
Absolutely horrible service! Made my drink wrong and refused to make it correctly. Would never recommend this place to anyone.
Good coffee. Pricey though. Staff a little too hip and aloof
Coffee is nothing amazing but it's cheap and the place has outlets ao no complaints ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Friendly staff, good espresso, nice assortment of breakfast sandwiches
Cool place. But majority of the workers are smug. Guy in afternoon on the weekdays is really cool though.
Tasty coffee, free wi-fi, big tables to work at. What else can a remote worker ask for?
Coffee is ok but sausage egg and cheese on English muffin is worth getting up for
Fabulous recommendation great coffee and service.  Like your home coffee shop for travellers
Good value, yummy bagels, friendly staff and fast service!
Great Saturday morning vibe with THE best sausage egg breakfast muffin in town!
Very nice quiet place to go just get on your computer get something to eat or have a drink.
My favorite coffee shop
Fun little cafe in the Tendernob. I like that the cafe is dog and cannabis friendly.
Best coffee and breakfast sandwiches in my local area! Will be a regular.
Coffee guy can be a little rude sometimes, but this place has great beer and coffee!
Friendly service!
Great red-eye coffee!
Friendly staff and let my dog in.... wonderful coffee
Great place for breakfast, free WiFi and tasty food.
Would be a decent place if it wasn't full of idiotic art academy students.
Not big on comfort, but VERY big on coffee. What you need in the morning.
Great little breakfast place, love their sandwiches!
Grabbed a cup of hot chocolate before going to the airport. Delicious!
Panini was very good, but no friendly atmosphere at all.
Lovely place to have a coffee break, not so friendly staff.
Terrible filthiest bathroom I've ever been in would not go back
I have witnessed so many oddities and strange moments at this place. 5/5 would drink coffee here again.
Nice n cozy coffee shop. Knowledgeable barista.
Great place friendly staff and cute art students hang out
A great place just to hang out on a sunny day in the city.
$2 beer during 3-10 happy hr
Great coffee and great atmosphere.
Upscale coffee house on the south slope of nob hill in downtown san fran.
$4.95 happy hour pints from 3-8
Decent pastries; wish happy hour was better.
Perfect place for coffee on a rainy SF morning
Great coffee. And chat with my Brazilian friend.
Fantastic latte with great service. Very quick.
right at the corner so you can park within a block of the place going in a any direction
Great Barista Coffee & Lovely Staff
A place in the sun - the wifi could be better though
Friendly service and decent matcha latte
Happy Hour Beers 3 pm - 10 pm
Great coffee huge breakfast sandwichs
Chill coffee place with wifi
Great coffee and good croissants
I was very disappointed of cafe latte's quality.
The food and service was grest.
Their breakfast sandwiches are very good
Sunny spot for coffee and snacks. A few beers on tap.
Coffee great and breakfast bun excellent
Good selection. Good happy hour.
Nice place with good drinks and ambiance
Fresno loves it here :)
Nice place, good coffee and beer.
Nice coffee. Nice atmosphere.
Perfect cafe in Nob Hill!
Good place to chill and write.
Good coffee and good bagels.
A definite landmark... A smile to the stalwarts!!! :)
Run of the mill coffee shop
Tasty capacinno and good service
Good
Grab a cofee here, really good
Yummy coffee and prompt service
Good Café Mocha
Great coffee and breakfast sandwiches
Outdoor seating!
Always a good stop
Very good place.
Mmmmmm coffffeeeee
Solid shop to kick it
Cool
Dog friendly!
Great choice
One of the best!
Coffee and art kids
Nice spot.
Mediocre service and services.
Good coffee
Nice place
I’m not overly exaggerating, but the best Americano I’ve ever had—perfect consistency and very rich in flavor. Not once. Every single time. Fantastic service.

Not having our hotel breakfast service, we chose this bar the first morning and then also the following ones since we liked it both as a place and as a service. We had tea and brioche and we liked them, but even the savory breakfasts had an inviting air. The guys are very kind and fast in the service.
A very good neighborhood café, including excellent Breakfast Sandwiches! The staff is also really friendly!
Best breakfast in SF! Great croissants and bagels! Great coffee! Great yoghurt parfait!
Good coffee and excellent banana bread 😍
Loved the place, several options for breakfast. Pleasant place and excellent service.
Very good breakfasts. Lots of space and good atmosphere.
Exceptional cappuccino to be in the States....
Very good breakfasts
Not bad
My open office a Frisco :)
very cozy
Fantastic
